title: symeig for variables
body_html:
this implements the symeig function for variables... I grabbed the gradient implementation directly from theano ... And I test it in this gist to show that it gets the same gradient as the theano version and that it passes gradcheck. I've also used this in actual networks so I'm fairly confident it's correct.

I obviously need to add actual tests, so any direction for that and anything else is much appreciated.
body_text:
this implements the symeig function for variables... I grabbed the gradient implementation directly from theano ... And I test it in this gist to show that it gets the same gradient as the theano version and that it passes gradcheck. I've also used this in actual networks so I'm fairly confident it's correct.

body:
this implements the symeig function for variables... I grabbed the gradient implementation directly from [theano](https://github.com/Theano/theano/blob/52903f8267cff316fc669e207eac4e2ecae952a6/theano/tensor/nlinalg.py#L432-L461) ... And I test it in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/ncullen93/9acefab137976712de0a51d88b39ffe7) to show that it gets the same gradient as the theano version and that it passes `gradcheck`. I've also used this in actual networks so I'm fairly confident it's correct.

I obviously need to add actual tests, so any direction for that and anything else is much appreciated.
